name: Core Payroll Concepts
description: Foundational payroll concepts, calculations, and common scenarios.

questions.prompt: Which document authorizes payroll to pay an employee?
choices: Timecard approval
Social media profile
Vendor invoice
Travel itinerary
questions.explanation: Payroll needs an authorized timecard approval to pay wages for hours worked.

questions.prompt: Which control best reduces the risk of paying terminated employees?
choices: Single sign-on
Daily termination feed to payroll
Allow manual overrides
Remove pay stubs
questions.explanation: A daily termination feed ensures payroll is updated promptly to stop payments.

questions.prompt: Select the items that are commonly required to retain for payroll recordkeeping.
choices: Employee name and SSN
Time and attendance records
Copy of every tax return
Rates of pay and basis
questions.explanation: Core payroll records include identifying info, time records, and rates of pay.

questions.prompt: The process of balancing payroll totals to source data is called _____.
questions.explanation: Reconciliation (tie-out) ensures totals agree with source data.

questions.prompt: Place the payroll cycle steps in order.
questions.explanation: Time collection precedes calculation, review, and final disbursement.

questions.prompt: Match the document to its purpose.
questions.explanation: Each document serves a distinct payroll or employment purpose.
